intro: Conostylis bracteata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces numerous seed heads that are adapted to disperse in windy conditions. Conostylis bracteata is an important component of native grasslands and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
